• luga
    • Requires jQuery in order to work
    • Lives inside its own namespace
    • .version
      • Reports the current version number
    • .namespace()
      • Creates namespaces to be used for scoping variables and classes
      • Does not override existing namespaces
      • By default uses window as root object
      • Accept a second argument to be used as root object
    • .extend()
      • Offers a simple solution for inheritance among classes
    • .lookupFunction()
      • Given the name of a function as a string
        • Returns the relevant function if it is available inside the window/global scope
        • Or any given namespace (if the fully qualified name is passed)
        • Returns undefined if:
          • The function does not exist
          • A corresponding object exists, but it's not a function
          • The name is undefined, null or an empty string
    • .lookupProperty()
      • Given an object and the path of a property as a string
        • Returns the propetry's value if it is available at the given path
        • Supports unlimited nesting levels (if the fully qualified path is passed)
        • Returns undefined if:
          • The property does not exist
          • The object is undefined, null or an empty string
          • The path is undefined, null or an empty string
    • .merge()
      • Shallow-merges the contents of two objects together into the first object
    • .setProperty()
      • Given an object, a path and a value
        • Set the property located at the given path to the given value
        • If the path does not exists, it creates it
        • Works on empty objects too
    • .Notifier
      • Is an interface class, it can only be used as a base class
      • Throws an exception if instantiated directly
      • .observers
        • Is an array
        • That contains all the observers
      • .addObserver()
        • Adds an observer object to the list of observers
        • Ensures that only objects are register as observers
      • .notifyObserver()
        • Is used to send a notification to all registered observers
        • Requires two parameters: eventName and data. Both are required
        • The data parameter must be an object
        • Observers must follow a naming convention. For an event named 'complete' they must implement a method named: 'onCompleteHandler'
        • The data parameter provides a means for passing data from the point of notification to all interested observers
      • .removeObserver()
        • Removes the given observer object
  • luga.form
    • Contains form-related API
    • .toQueryString()
      • Returns a string of name/value pairs from fields contained inside a given node
      • Throws an exception if the given node does not exists
      • Ignores unsuccessful fields
      • Names and values are URI encoded
      • Values of multiple checked checkboxes are included as multiple value/pairs
      • Values of multiple select are included as multiple value/pairs
      • If the second argument is set to true, MS Word's special chars are replaced with plausible substitutes
    • .toHash()
      • Return a JavaScript object containing name/value pairs from fields contained inside a given node
      • Throws an exception if the given node does not exists
      • Ignores unsuccessful fields
      • Values of multiple checked checkboxes are included as a single entry, with array value
      • Values of multiple select are included as a single entry, with comma-delimited value
      • If the second argument is set to true, MS Word's special chars are replaced with plausible substitutes
    • .toJson()
      • Given a form tag or another element wrapping input fields, serialize them into JSON data
      • Throws an exception if the given node does not exists
      • Ignores unsuccessful fields
      • Values of multiple checked checkboxes are included as a single entry, with array value
      • Values of multiple select are included as a single entry, with comma-delimited value
      • Requires luga.form.toHash() in order to work
    • .utils
      • Contains form-related, static methods and utilities
      • .getFieldGroup()
        • Extracts group of fields that share the same name from
          • A given root node
          • Or the whole document if the second argument is not passed
      • .getChildFields()
        • Returns an array of input fields contained inside a given root node
        • Returns an empty array if there are no suitable input fields
      • .isInputField()
        • Returns true if the passed node is a form field that we care about
        • False otherwise
      • .isSuccessfulField()
        • Returns false if the field is disabled
        • Returns true if the given field is successful
        • False otherwise
  • luga.string
    • Contains string-related API
    • .demoronize()
      • Given a string
        • Replace MS Word's non-ISO characters with plausible substitutes
    • .format()
      • Given a string containing placeholders
        • It assembles a new string replacing the placeholders with the strings contained inside the second argument
        • The string can contains multiple instances of the same placeholder
        • If no matching placeholder is find, return the original string
      • The second argument can be either:
        • An array:
          • In which case placeholders need to be in {index} format
        • An object containing name/value pairs:
          • In which case placeholders need to be in {key} format
    • .queryToHash()
      • Given a string in querystring format, return an object containing name/value pairs
        • A '?' at the beginning of the string is ignored
        • If a name has no associated value, the hash contains an entry with an empty string value
        • Names and values are URI decoded
        • If the same name is contained multiple times inside the queryString, the matching entry inside the hash is an array
        • If the given string is empty, an empty hash is returned
        • If the given string is '?', an empty hash is returned
    • .replaceProperty()
      • Given a string containing placeholders in {placeholder} format
        • It assembles a new string replacing the placeholders with the strings contained inside the second argument
        • The string can contains multiple instances of the same placeholder
        • If no matching placeholder is find, return the original string
        • If the second argument is not an object, return the original string
      • The second argument is:
        • An object containing keys:
          • Placeholders must match a key
          • Placeholders can match nested properties too
  • luga.utils
    • Contains generic, static methods and utilities
    • .displayMessage()
      • Displays a message box above a given node
    • .displayErrorMessage()
      • Displays an error box above a given node
